contents.item: Killers aren't always assassins. Sometimes, they don't even have blood on their hands.
contents.owner: Ruta Sepetys, Salt to the Sea

contents.item: So since I'm still here livin',I guess I will live on.I could've died for love--But for livin' I was born.
Dead, we are revealed in our true dimensions, and they are surprisingly modest.
I look back to where my life had been. It's always risky to think of letting go. That's why this is the perfect ending. Nothing left to reconcile.
Silence before being born, silence after death: life is nothing but noise between two unfathomable silences.

When was it I realized that, on this truly dark and solitary path we all walk, the only way we can light is our own? Although I was raised with love, I was always lonely.Someday, without fail, everyone will disappear, scattered into the blackness of time.
You will have five hundred million little bells, and I shall have five hundred million springs of fresh water...
contents.owner: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, The Little Prince

contents.item: If life was a dream, then dying must be the moment when you woke up. It was so simple it must be true. You died, the dream was over, you woke up. That's what people meant when they talked about going to heaven. It was like waking up.
But spending your life concentrating on death is like watching a whole movie and thinking only about the credits that are going to roll at the end. It’s a mistake of emphasis.

There really is only one ending to any story. Human life ends in death. Until then, it keeps going and gets complicated and there's loss. Everything involves loss; every relationship ends in one way or another.
My reasons to liveWere my reasons to dieBut at least they were mineNow I've freedom unboundCut the laces of life

But I’m not guilty,” said K. “there’s been a mistake. How is it even possible for someone to be guilty? We’re all human beings here, one like the other.” “That is true” said the priest “but that is how the guilty speak

What will be left of all the fearing and wanting associated with your problematic life situation that every day takes up most of your attention? A dash, one or two inches long, between the date of birth and date of death on your gravestone.
Because you can only die once but you can suffer forever.
contents.owner: Shaun David Hutchinson, We Are the Ants

contents.item: Dying is only one thing to be sad over. Living unhappily is something else.
To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.
contents.owner: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

contents.item: I do not fear death. I had been dead for billions and billions of years before I was born, and had not suffered the slightest inconvenience from it.
When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.

there is a place in the heart thatwill never be filleda spaceand even during thebest momentsandthe greatest timestimeswe will know itwe will know itmore thaneverthere is a place in the heart thatwill never be filledandwe will waitandwaitin that space.
No one really knows why they are alive until they know what they'd die for.
